name: Upright Row, on Multi Press
how_to_perform:
1. Stand facing a multi press machine with the handles at shoulder height or slightly above.
2. Grip the handles with an overhand grip, palms facing away from your body.
3. Place your feet shoulder-width apart on either side of the machine and engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine.
4. Pull the bars towards your chest while keeping your elbows high and tight against your sides, squeezing your shoulder blades together as you lift.
5. Focus on using your shoulders to pull the weight up, avoiding swinging or jerking motions that can put unnecessary strain on your lower back.
6. Once you've reached the top of the movement, slowly return the bars to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The upright row is an upper body exercise targeting the shoulders, performed using a multi press machine.
alternative_names: Standing Upright Rows on Multi Press Machine
